title: 112_hr3115
content: The Act titled "Ensuring the Effective Use of United States Aid to Pakistan Act" prohibits the provision of non-security assistance to Pakistan. The Act prohibits providing non-security assistance to Pakistan under specific provisions of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The Act authorizes the Secretary of State to provide assistance for international disaster relief, refugee support, and food security through various programs and organizations. The Act authorizes assistance for international disaster relief, refugee support, and food security through various programs and organizations, including provisions related to grants for agricultural commodities, assistance in developing countries, and support for Pakistan. The prohibition on assistance to Pakistan under certain acts shall apply. The provisions described in subsection (b)(7) of this section will apply, regardless of section 2(f) of the Migration and Refugee Assistance Act of 1962. SEC. 3. REQUIREMENTS FOR PROVISION OF SECURITY ASSISTANCE TO PAKISTAN. Security assistance to Pakistan is contingent upon the President certifying to Congress that Pakistan is cooperating with the US in counterterrorism efforts, not hindering US counterterrorism actions, and using the assistance for border security, counter-terrorism, and law enforcement purposes. The President must recertify every 6 months that Pakistan is meeting conditions for security assistance, including cooperation in counterterrorism efforts and using aid for border security and law enforcement. These conditions are additional to any other laws governing assistance to Pakistan. The Act takes effect on the date of enactment. Section 2 applies to assistance to Pakistan under specific laws enacted after this Act, while Section 3 applies to assistance under other laws for each fiscal year after the Act's enactment.
